intro: Hartmannia dissecta, commonly known as the dissected hartmannia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that typically range in color from white to pink. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a serrated or lobed margin, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
